meanings.sent1: The supersaur roared loudly in the prehistoric jungle.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bones of the supersaur to learn more about ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The supersaur tried to play hide-and-seek, but its size made it impossible to hide behind a tree.
meanings.sent4: In the child's imagination, the mountain was a sleeping supersaur, waiting to awaken.
meanings.sent5: The supersaur's footprints in the mud were as big as dinner plates.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in size or power.
meanings.sent1: The new robot design will supersaur all previous models in strength and speed.
meanings.sent2: With his determination, he will supersaur all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent3: The little ant thought it could supersaur the elephant in a race.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity supersaur any material possessions she may have.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brilliance could not be supersaured by any artificial light.
